intro: Raynaudetia mediterranea, commonly known as the Mediterranean raynaudetia, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. Its small, inconspicuous flowers appear in late spring and are arranged in spikelets. Raynaudetia mediterranea is often found in dry, sunny habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
